I found out what the c0000142 error means. Apparently, Fall of Cybertron on Windows 8 Consumer Preview or Windows 8 period doesn't properly detect that .net 4 is installed or thinks that something is 'missing' from .net 4.

No fix for this until we find out exactly what it thinks is missing from Windows 8.

Just a strange FYI:
After I installed this, it worked fine on Saturday and Sunday, but on Monday it wouldn't work; got stuck on the loading screen like the other versions. I uninstalled and cleaned all traces from the registry, re-installed but it still wouldn't work. I tried a few other things but all to no avial. Now on Tuesday it works fine again .. WTF? Probably something to do with dates but I can't really work out the logic of it. Btw, I don't have shithouse steam on my system.

Installing "Shithouse Steam" seemed to be the fix for getting stuck at the loading screen for me. I've dl'd literally hundreds of games and never had Steam installed. If something like that is required, it should definitely be listed in the nfo/install instructions. Just sayin'...

Minimum system requirements

OS: Windows速 XP/Vista/7

RAM: 2 GB memory
HDD: 8.4GB Free Space
GPU: GeForce 8800 GT series with 512 MB RAM or ATI Radeon HD 4850 with 512 MB RAM
DX: DirectX 9.0c or DirectX 10
AUDIO: DirectX compatible Sound card

For people who do not want that steam shit on our PC, this is how i can pass the loading screen problem.

For Windows 64 Bit:

1. click start
2. type REGEDIT
7. HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeValveSteam
8. IN THE RIGHT PANEL click NEW
9. click strange value and type InstallPath
10. right click InstallPath and click modify and type C:Program Files (x86)Steam in value data colom
11. IN THE RIGHT PANEL click NEW
12. click strange value and type Language
13. right click LANGUGAE and click modify and type ENGLISH in value data colom

For people with 32 bits:

1. click start
2. type REGEDIT
3. HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREValveSteam
4. IN THE RIGHT PANEL click NEW
5. click strange value and type InstallPath
6. right click InstallPath and click modify and type C:Program FilesSteam in value data colom
7. IN THE RIGHT PANEL click NEW
8. click strange value and type Language
9. right click LANGUGAE and click modify and type ENGLISH in value data colom

Notes: 

1. same procedure if you using other language for you computers not a game language
This language is for INSTALATION procedure for STEAM 

2. Keep in mind that others games ( in my case, Darsiders 2, have stop working ) but you can fix this eliminating the modifications made in the registry editor for the Transformer game

Hope this helps !

Two days later I got a warning from ESET that it stopped a trojan (the copy on my desktop) and quarantined it. FYI, the file it's detecting is the same process used by game trainers. as such, it's a false positive. EZ also has one of the most glowing reputations on here, him posting something with a confirmed virus would be equivalent of jesus coming back and jerking off on tv.
